questionnaire.question: Has the board formally assigned responsibility for overseeing climate-related risks and opportunities?
questionnaire.gapDescription: The board hasn’t formally been assigned responsibility for overseeing climate risks and opportunities.
questionnaire.recommendation: Update board mandates or committee charters to explicitly assign climate oversight duties.
questionnaire.relevantClause: Paragraph 6(a)(i)—requires disclosure of how responsibilities are reflected in board terms of reference.

questionnaire.question: Does the board receive regular (at least annual) updates on climate-related issues?
questionnaire.gapDescription: The board isn’t receiving consistent updates on climate issues.
questionnaire.recommendation: Establish a formal reporting cadence (e.g., quarterly climate updates) to the board.
questionnaire.relevantClause: Paragraph 6(a)(iii)—states how often and how the board is informed about climate-related risks.

questionnaire.question: Are climate-related responsibilities embedded into committee structures or individual roles?
questionnaire.gapDescription: Climate oversight isn’t embedded into formal governance roles or committees.
questionnaire.recommendation: Delegate responsibility to a dedicated board committee or officer with defined role descriptions.
questionnaire.relevantClause: Paragraph 6(a)(ii)—addresses embedding responsibilities in terms of reference.

questionnaire.question: Does the board have climate competence (skills/experience) or access to expert advice?
questionnaire.gapDescription: The board lacks climate-related skills or access to expert advice.
questionnaire.recommendation: Provide training or appoint a climate-savvy advisor to leadership.
questionnaire.relevantClause: Paragraph 6(a)(ii)—pertains to developing necessary competencies.

questionnaire.question: Are climate-related performance metrics included in executive remuneration and incentive structures?
questionnaire.gapDescription: Climate-related performance is not linked to executive remuneration.
questionnaire.recommendation: Add climate metrics to remuneration scorecards and disclose linkage and weighting.
questionnaire.relevantClause: Paragraph 6(c)—how climate objectives and performance are reflected in remuneration policies.

questionnaire.question: Has management been assigned responsibility for climate-related risks and opportunities?
questionnaire.gapDescription: Management climate responsibilities are not formally assigned.
questionnaire.recommendation: Assign named executives with climate duties and define reporting to the board.
questionnaire.relevantClause: Paragraph 6(b)—management’s role in governance and reporting lines.

questionnaire.question: Has the organisation identified and documented climate-related risks and opportunities over short, medium, and long term?
questionnaire.gapDescription: Climate-related risks and opportunities across time horizons aren’t fully documented.
questionnaire.recommendation: Identify key risks/opportunities and document their effects over short, medium, and long term.
questionnaire.relevantClause: Paragraphs 10 and 11—require description of climate risks/opportunities and time horizons.

questionnaire.question: Has climate scenario analysis been performed to assess resilience of strategy?
questionnaire.gapDescription: Scenario analysis assessing climate resilience hasn’t been conducted.
questionnaire.recommendation: Perform scenario analysis using at least two pathways — 1.5 °C and a higher-warming scenario.
questionnaire.relevantClause: Paragraph 22 and B4–B12—require use of scenario analysis to assess climate resilience.

questionnaire.question: Have climate-related impacts been integrated into business strategy and financial planning?
questionnaire.gapDescription: Climate impacts aren’t integrated into strategy or financial planning.
questionnaire.recommendation: Embed climate considerations into decision-making, budgeting, and forecasting processes.
questionnaire.relevantClause: Paragraphs 9(b)–(d)—effects on strategy, business model, cash flows, and transition planning.

questionnaire.question: Has the organisation assessed the impact of climate-related risks and opportunities on its business model and value chain?
questionnaire.gapDescription: Impacts on business model and value chain are not assessed or documented.
questionnaire.recommendation: Assess climate impacts across operations and the value chain and document material effects.
questionnaire.relevantClause: Paragraph 9(a)–(b)—effects on business model and value chain.

questionnaire.question: Has the organisation developed a climate transition plan with clear targets and timelines?
questionnaire.gapDescription: No documented transition plan with targets and timelines.
questionnaire.recommendation: Develop and publish a credible transition plan with milestones, resources and governance.
questionnaire.relevantClause: Paragraph 9(d) and 13—transition plans and implementation.

questionnaire.question: Has the organisation quantified the financial impact of climate-related risks and opportunities?
questionnaire.gapDescription: Financial effects of climate risks and opportunities are not quantified.
questionnaire.recommendation: Quantify current and expected impacts on cash flows, financial position and performance.
questionnaire.relevantClause: Paragraph 14—quantitative and qualitative financial effects.

questionnaire.question: Has the organisation established processes for identifying climate-related risks?
questionnaire.gapDescription: There is no formal process to identify climate-related risks.
questionnaire.recommendation: Implement structured risk identification processes aligned with enterprise risk frameworks.
questionnaire.relevantClause: Paragraph 25—covers process for identifying, assessing, and prioritising risks.

questionnaire.question: Are climate-related risks integrated into the organisation's overall risk management framework?
questionnaire.gapDescription: Climate risks aren’t integrated into overall enterprise risk management (ERM).
questionnaire.recommendation: Embed climate risk into existing ERM systems and controls.
questionnaire.relevantClause: Paragraph 6(a)(iv) and paragraph 25—expect integration with enterprise-wide risk management.

questionnaire.question: Has the organisation established processes for assessing and prioritising climate-related risks?
questionnaire.gapDescription: Processes to assess and prioritise climate risks are incomplete.
questionnaire.recommendation: Establish criteria and thresholds to assess likelihood, severity and prioritisation of risks.
questionnaire.relevantClause: Paragraph 25—assessing and prioritising climate-related risks.

questionnaire.question: Are climate-related opportunities captured and managed through formal processes?
questionnaire.gapDescription: Opportunities are not formally captured or managed.
questionnaire.recommendation: Set processes to identify and manage climate opportunities with accountable owners.
questionnaire.relevantClause: Paragraphs 10–11—disclosure of climate-related opportunities.

questionnaire.question: Are climate-related risks monitored, reviewed, and updated on a regular basis?
questionnaire.gapDescription: Ongoing monitoring and review of climate risks is ad hoc.
questionnaire.recommendation: Define monitoring cadence, triggers and controls; report results to management and board.
questionnaire.relevantClause: Paragraph 25(c)—monitoring and reviewing risks.

questionnaire.question: Are Scope 1 and Scope 2 GHG emissions measured in line with recognised standards?
questionnaire.gapDescription: Scope 1 and/or Scope 2 emissions are not measured per recognised standards.
questionnaire.recommendation: Calculate these emissions using GHG Protocol and document results.
questionnaire.relevantClause: Pillar category “Metrics and targets”—requires disclosure of Scope 1 and 2 emissions.

questionnaire.question: Are Scope 3 GHG emissions measured and reported?
questionnaire.gapDescription: Scope 3 emissions aren’t measured or reported.
questionnaire.recommendation: Conduct a materiality-based Scope 3 inventory and report findings.
questionnaire.relevantClause: Pillar “Metrics and targets” – includes Scope 3 disclosure obligations.

questionnaire.question: Has the organisation set climate-related targets consistent with AASB S2 requirements?
questionnaire.gapDescription: Climate-related targets haven’t been set or disclosed.
questionnaire.recommendation: Set measurable emissions or climate impact targets and disclose them publicly.
questionnaire.relevantClause: Paragraphs 33–36—expect disclosure of climate-related targets and progress tracking.

questionnaire.question: Are climate-related metrics tracked and reported internally on a regular basis?
questionnaire.gapDescription: Internal tracking of climate metrics is not regular or systematic.
questionnaire.recommendation: Implement periodic KPI tracking and dashboards aligned to disclosed metrics.
questionnaire.relevantClause: Paragraphs 27–31—metrics used to manage and monitor performance.

questionnaire.question: Are climate-related targets externally assured or verified?
questionnaire.gapDescription: Targets are not externally validated or assured.
questionnaire.recommendation: Engage an independent assurer to verify target methodologies and performance.
questionnaire.relevantClause: Paragraphs 35–36—disclose target measurement methods and monitoring (assurance recommended).

questionnaire.question: Are climate-related performance metrics integrated into financial reporting?
questionnaire.gapDescription: Climate metrics are not integrated into financial reporting.
questionnaire.recommendation: Integrate material climate metrics into financial reporting processes and controls.
questionnaire.relevantClause: Paragraph 14—financial effects disclosure and linkage to financial statements.

metadata.title: AASB S2 Climate Readiness Questionnaire
metadata.description: Comprehensive assessment of organisational readiness for AASB S2 climate-related financial disclosure requirements

sections.title: Governance
sections.description: Board oversight and management accountability for climate-related risks and opportunities

sections.title: Strategy
sections.description: Integration of climate-related risks and opportunities into business strategy and financial planning

sections.title: Risk Management
sections.description: Processes for identifying, assessing, and managing climate-related risks and opportunities

sections.title: Metrics & Targets
sections.description: Measurement, tracking, and disclosure of climate-related metrics and targets
